page.title: 09Traffic in Halesowen
page.content: A new shopping precinct was built in 1969. Open to pedestrian traffic, vehicles were diverted along the Queensway, parking being provided free for shoppers and business. A bus station is sited alongside the precinct. Bus services provide access to the majority of neighbouring villages,towns and cities. Roads to Birmingham, Kidderminster Dudley and Stourbridge by-pass the town centre preventing traffic hold ups. The M5 motorway allows access to the South West and the rest of the motorway system. The headquarters of the Automobile Association (A.A.) are based in Halesowen. The railway was closed in 1968.
